title: Calories in a Cookie
meta_description: Discover calories in a cookie, including macros like carbs, protein, and fat, plus per-cookie nutrition facts and variations for different types.
assumptions: Standard chocolate chip cookie, ~30 g, baked with butter, flour, sugar, and chocolate chips; average store-bought or homemade.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, size, ingredients, and baking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard chocolate chip cookie has about 140 kcal and 2 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Oatmeal raisin version (swap chips for raisins and oats)
Add walnuts (1 tbsp chopped per cookie)

faqs.q: How many calories in a chocolate chip cookie?
faqs.a: About 140 kcal for a standard 30 g cookie.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a cookie?
faqs.a: Roughly 18 g carbs, including 10 g sugars and 1 g fiber per cookie.
Yes, about 7 g total fat, with 3 g saturated per standard cookie.

faqs.q: How does cookie size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger cookies (50 g) can have 200+ kcal; smaller ones under 100 kcal.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in a cookie?
faqs.a: Typically low at 2 g per cookie, mostly from flour and any nuts.
